message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it focuses on building unsupervised representations of text entities and their compositions. It also mentions tasks such as measuring sentence similarity and word entailment, which are common in natural language processing. 

It could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it proposes a framework for representation learning using Optimal Transport and Wasserstein distance. 

Additionally, the paper mentions the use of low-dimensional space for embedding contexts, which is a common technique in computer vision (cs.CV) and neural networks (cs.NE). Therefore, these two sub-categories are also likely candidates.
